New Records: The Phillies ended a 34-game winning streak when their starter pitched seven or more innings, which was the longest streak in franchise history and the second-longest streak in MLB history.
Key Match Events: The Phillies' 2-1 walk-off loss to the Brewers, Aaron Nola's brilliant pitching performance, Rhys Hoskins' solo homer in the fifth inning, Alec Bohm's solo homer in the second inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies had a seven-game lead over the Mets with 10 games to play, they were trying to clinch their first NL East title in 13 years, the Brewers were trying to catch the Dodgers for the NL's No. 2 seed
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Nola's comeback performance, the Phillies' inability to get anything going offensively, striking out 16 times, Phillies manager Rob Thomson's comments on needing to get back to their two-strike approach
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies' potential postseason preview, the Brewers' clinching of the NL Central, the possibility of a rematch between the Phillies and Brewers in the NL Championship Series
Others: The Phillies' reliance on Nola's performance, their high strikeout totals in recent games, their confidence in their lineup against any team
